text:
Hey guys, it’s Ro, welcome to another Nerdy
Nummies!

I got so many requests from you guys to make
something Avengers themed, in honor of the

new movie, Age of Ultron. So, I thought why
not make something that you could eat for dinner

before you go see the movie, that’s what
I’m doing. Today is gonna be super easy mode,

for those of you who have been requesting
something easy, today’s the day, today we are

gonna be making a Captain America themed pizza,
because, he’s the first Avenger!
And I love him! Let’s get started!

We are gonna be making our pizza dough from
scratch, so the things you will need

for the dough, will be: 2 cups of warm water,
2-1/2 cups of regular all purpose flour,
and then we have this bowl of flour over here, we'll talk about that later, this is just extra,
then you’ll need 2 packets of

quick rising yeast, 1 teaspoon of salt, 1
teaspoon of sugar, 1 tablespoon of honey.

To decorate our pizza we are gonna need some
pizza sauce, yum-yum-yum-yum-yum! You can

use whatever your favorite sauce is, some
olives, some mozzarella cheese, we have shredded

and then the slices, pepperonis, a little
star cookie cutter, and a pizza pan.
Now, let’s put it all together!

The first thing that we’re gonna do is we
are gonna mix together our warm water, yeast

and sugar, together in a big mixing bowl.
Now, if you don’t have a stand mixer that has

a dough hook, that’s OK because you can
mix it up with a spoon or by hand.

But because I’ve got the stand mixer with
the dough hook, I’m gonna use it!

Alright, so first you’re gonna add your
yeast, 2 packets of yeast. Now we’re gonna add

the warm water, and remember you want the
water to be warm, not hot, because if the water is

too hot, it will kill the yeast! So just a
good reminder, you want warm water, not hot.
And then, a little bit of sugar.

You’re gonna mix this together until it’s
well combined, and then let it sit for 5 minutes.

And while it’s sitting you can tell a really
good joke,

like, what did the bag of flour say to the
loaf of bread?
I saw you yeast-erday! Wah-wah-wah-wah-wah!

Now we’re gonna add some more ingredients,
we’re gonna add the 2-1/2 cups of regular flour,

dump it in there! Then, add your salt, boop!
And your honey, oh my, this is gonna be awhile.

Now we’re gonna mix these together until
they’re evenly combined, and then, this is where

the extra flour comes into play, once the
mixture is mixed, we’re gonna be adding
1/2 a cup

at a time until the dough doesn’t stick
to your hands.

So, it varies, sometimes it ends up being
4 cups, sometimes… Not.
Yeast… Whatcha gon’ do?

Now that we’ve got our dough mixed up, we
are gonna place it into an oiled bowl,

so here I got a big bowl. You might want to
get a bowl that’s a little bit bigger than you’d

think because the dough is going to rise,
and I’ve got a little bit of olive oil,

so I’m just gonna put a little bit in here.
Doo-doo-doo-doo! Then I’m just gonna take a paper towel,

and wipe it around, get all
the edges, all the surface. Look at that!

It’s soft, but it’s not sticking to my
hands. And just place it right in the middle.

Then you’re just gonna cover it with cling
wrap.

Now we’ve got our pizza dough all wrapped,
I’m gonna set it off to the side at room temperature

and you want to let it set for at least 30
minutes for it to rise, but longer is better.

Look at our dough! It has risen so much, this
is awesome! Now this recipe is for 2 pizzas

because I always eat with a lot of friends.
And now I’m just gonna pick up 1/2 of the dough,

this is a lot of dough for a little lady,
oh my! So let’s see what we can do!
Oh my gosh, these look like lungs!
Huh-hah, huh-hah! OK!

You want to shape your pizza dough into a
circle. And remember, you don’t want to use a rolling
pin here, you can,but you really don't want to,

because when you roll this dough it’s going to take all
the air bubbles out of the dough, and it just isn't

going to rise correctly, it’s just not gonna
have that pizza texture that you like, so,
use your hands!

And if you want to get fancy with it, this
is what you do, you this, a spin…. Like that!

Just keep stretching it out, pulling it to
the edges of the pan.

Once you’ve stretched the dough to fit the
pan, now you’re gonna take your little phalanges,

your little pincers, and you’re just gonna
pinch, pinch, pinch, around the outer edge, because
I like to have a little bit of that crust!

Before we put any toppings on, you’re gonna
heat your oven to 425 degrees, and we’re
gonna bake our dough for 10 minutes.

Just took the pizza dough out of the oven,
make sure it’s had a few minutes to cool because

the pan is really hot and you don’t want
to burn yourself when you’re decorating.
I’ve been there, I’ve done that!

OK, so the first thing you’re gonna do is
take your pizza sauce, a little spoon, and

I'm just gonna spoon sauce all over the pizza,
you can use a little or a lot, whatever you like.

Now we’re gonna add just a little bit of
mozzarella shredded cheese, just a light layer,

all over the pizza. Now take your mozzarella
shredded cheese and just set it off to the side.

I’m gonna keep it close though because I’m
not done, I just put a little bit down because

I wanted the whole pizza to have cheese on
it.

And now you’re gonna grab your olives, I
love olives, mmm!

Take a handful of olives and you’re gonna
chop them up finely.

Now I’m gonna take a handful of my diced
olives, and put them in the center of the pizza,

and you want them to sit in a circle shape,
so you can either eyeball it, or you can use

anything you have lying around the house,
whether it’s a bowl or a circle cookie cutter,

just something that will give you an outline.
Next thing that we’re gonna do to decorate

our pizza is add the star. This is my favorite!
So you’re gonna take slices of mozzarella,

I found these at the grocery store. So I wanted
 to be a little bit extra thick,

so I’m gonna take 2 slices and stack them
directly on top of each other, and then you’re

gonna take your star cookie cutter, and cut
out the shape.

Alright, then we’re gonna transfer our cheese
right into the middle of our olives.

Time for the pepperoni! So take a bunch of little
pepperonis, and then I’m gonna cut just

a little bit off the top so that they are 75% their size,
and then I get snacks for me!
Nom-nom-nom-nom-nom-nom-nom-nom!

And then, you’re gonna place them all the
way around the sides of the olives.

We just did our first ring of pepperoni all
the way around our olives, and now you’re gonna

grab your shredded mozzarella cheese again,
and now, you’re gonna put a layer all the

way around the pepperoni. This is gonna be the
white part of the shield,
so you’re gonna want to use a lot!

Now for our final decoration step we are gonna
add the last ring of red pepperonis around
the outside! Oooooh! Yum-yum-yum-yum-yum!

Now we’re done decorating our pizza and
it is time to bake, you’re gonna pop it
in the oven

at temperature 425 degrees and you’re gonna
bake it between 10 to 15 minutes,
just keep your eye on it.
Ta-da!

Here’s our Captain America inspired pizza!
Thanks you guys for suggesting something avengers,

I can’t wait to go see the new movie, I’m
super excited.

I’ll be posting lots of pictures of this
yummy pizza on Facebook, Tumblr, Instagram
and Twitter.

And if you guys make this pizza or any Avenger
themed pizza, please take a picturee and send

them to me, I love to re-blog them and re-post
them. I just get a big kick out of it, I love
seeing your creations, makes my day!

And if you have any other ideas for any other
Nerdy Nummies, please let me know, leave me a

comment down below and I will do my best to
make it happen!
Alright, thanks again you guys, bye-bye!
